ProjectTitle: Augustine of Hippo's De civitate Dei in the Central Middle Ages (10th-12th c.): Transmission History and Reception in Theological Debates
InitialFeedbackHistory: 12/07/2022 - Please use the appropriate template for your funder (FWO), which you can find via https://dmponline.kuleuven.be. - [REDACTED] content of this plan is good overall, so for many questions, you can simply copy-paste the appropriate parts of the text. - [REDACTED] DMP template contains a few important questions not yet answered in your text. [REDACTED] example, there are two sections on long-term preservation and data sharing. [REDACTED] other words, how you plan to archive your research data after the end of your project for at least 10 years (the term mandated by KU [REDACTED] and how you plan to share your research data. A few tips on these sections: [REDACTED] RDM terms, reliable long-term preservation of data must is best accomplished by using of tools that are specifically designed to store (academic) data for long periods of time. [REDACTED] practice, your best option is to store all data in a data repository, like [REDACTED] or KU [REDACTED] new repository RDR (https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr). [REDACTED] using a repository, you also kill two birds with one stone, as repositories are also perfect tools for "data sharing" in RDM terms. [REDACTED] you're unfamiliar with data repositories, check out the link to RDR or look around in the older repository [REDACTED] for examples of what others are sharing.
